Who: LEGACY, Rat Trap, Tuscon, Quickstride, Kup
Location: Area outside of t=
he Black Fortress

> "Lord Elder, Perceptor, I want you to know that if you=
 were to chose between saving your own life, and the lives of your comrades=
, you would probably want to save your comrades instead of yourselves. The =
compassion for a comrade has far out powered my better judgement for surviv=
al. I can not deny what my heart spark tells me. And it has told me that th=
ere is no greater power than that which is held by all Autobots and Maximal=
s a like. Rat Trap, I hear you too, I know this is upsetting you greatly, a=
nd if you had not extended your own heart spark to help me the first time, =
I would not have made it this far. All of you who worry for me, take heart,=
 I've been through worse. And please, understand that I failed Rodimus once=
, I will not fail him a second time."

"Of course." Lord elder responded ba=
ck. "But if I were attempting to
do the same thing that you were doing, wha=
t would you be saying." He
sighed, knowing that even as he spoke that Tusco=
n had already gone on
anyway.

> " By the Matrix.. Lord Elder, Legacy, Perc=
eptor, I've got my vision back. I can now see everything around me clearly.=
 Now, I can also hear Rodimus on the other end. I'm attempting to get throu=
gh the rubble, but it may take a moment or so to do it."
>
> As he continue=
s to dig, he keeps an ear out for Rodimus.
>
> "Rodimus, if you can hear me=
, I need you to follow my voice and dig through the rubble on your end, to =
meet up with me. I've got my vision back and I am now fully capable of gett=
ing us both out of here safely. Please, respond."

As Tuscon dug and pushed=
, the debris rumbled. As anyone knows, once
there has been a land slide, to=
 move the supporting debris only risks
another slide. The dirt and such tha=
t Tuscon moves is light and sandy,
had he been a farmer, no doubt he would =
have realized that this
accounts for much of the scrub that grew around thi=
s area, the soil
had so little nutrients, built as it was on volcanic rock =
beneath.

However when Tuscon was finally able to break through to the othe=
r
side there was no Rodimus to see or any of the other Decepticons for
that=
 matter: Cyclonus, Scourge, Scorponok and Jhiaxus were all absent.
Instead =
there was only the opening of some large pit, perhaps 15 or 20
feet across =
from which the smell of sulfur and other strange gasses
rose.

Had Tuscon r=
ead the old reports of Kup and Grimlock's tunneling
expedition while follow=
ing Scorponok, then he might connect that to
the pit he saw before him. It =
ran deep, its sides sloping down rather
sharply, although the floor of it w=
as exceedingly smooth. It was part
of the original tunnel that led far unde=
rground and in the direction
of the Ark.

Perhaps several hundred yards dow=
n the tunnel/pit there was a dark
form, something that MIGHT be Rodimus. Wh=
o or what ever it was it lay
totally unmoving, unresponsive to anything tha=
t Tuscon has done so
far.

But then the sound of water could be heard as if=
 some small
underground dam had burst, and then steam began billowing up fr=
om the
hole obscuring sight. The last view Tuscon could see of the figure w=
as
that it moved, as if pushed by something, and then it was totally lost
f=
rom sight.


Meanwhile . . .

Who: LEGACY, Rat Trap, Quickstride, Kup
Locat=
ion: Area outside of the Black Fortress

> " That's a good hope ta have Qui=
ckstride. We gotta believe in Tucson, guys. That's our greatest power, beli=
eve in our allies and our friends. Somethn' Hydras doesn't usually practice=
."
>
> Night Shift turns to Legacy.
>
> " Belief is all we got gon' for us =
now Legacy. We gotta hold onta that."

Legacy paused as he listened to the =
others as his own sensors
continued to scan the area.

"Belief is inconsequ=
ential if it cannot be supported by fact." Legacy
said, ever the bot that w=
as rooted in empirical logic. "Historically
Optimus Prime was renowned for =
his ability to act in unpredictable
ways and still emerge victorious, as wa=
s Optimus Primal. However
neither of them are still with us."

"I would sus=
pect that Tuscon is now motivated by the emotions of guilt
and fear. Guilt =
that he has allowed Rodimus to left behind and fear
that he may be lost aga=
in. Hardly the motivators that allow for the
optimal success for his missio=
n."

Legacy transformed into robot mode, setting down anyone who may still
=
have been riding inside of him. "I would recommend that Talon or Rat
Trap t=
ake the injured back to the ark in the shuttle and then the rest
of us atte=
mpt to locate Tuscon and Rodimus."

Legacy's cold cyclopian gaze swept the =
group as he spoke. "We cannot
know the condition of the Predacons or Decept=
icon, and if in his
current state that Tuscon has not pushed himself into a=
nother
situation that it will be difficult to extricate himself from alone.=
"

(TAG)

Preston
